name: CONFORMANCE CRITERIA - CEMP prepared and provided to TSC for approval by the Environmental Project Manager or their delegate
○ Site specific ESCP to be included in CEMP
CONFORMANCE CRITERIA - JSEA prepared and signed off
CONFORMANCE CRITERIA - Survey Setout complete and Extent of Works confirmed
CONFORMANCE CRITERIA - Permit to disturb in place
CONFORMANCE CRITERIA - Preclearing Inspection undertaken 24hr prior to works.
○ Endangered Community to be identified by suitably qualified ecologist and area to be flagged off. Refer Section 10.1 of REF. Delineate and protect trees and flora
○ Cleared & grubbed material pushed of to the side of works alignment
CONFORMANCE CRITERIA - Lot conforms to specifications
○ All NCRs actioned and closed out
CONFORMANCE CRITERIA - CEMP prepared and provided to TSC for approval by the Environmental Project Manager or their delegate
○ Site specific ESCP to be included in CEMP
CONFORMANCE CRITERIA - JSEA prepared and signed off
Drainage and Dust Controls in place if required
CONFORMANCE CRITERIA - As per the Construction Environmental Management Plan
CONFORMANCE CRITERIA - Survey set out and complete
CONFORMANCE CRITERIA - Strip 100mm Topsoil to stockpile
CONFORMANCE CRITERIA - Post strip survey completed where required
CONFORMANCE CRITERIA - Lot conforms to specifications
○ All NCRs actioned and closed out
CONFORMANCE CRITERIA - JSEA prepared and signed off
Drainage and Dust Controls in place if required
CONFORMANCE CRITERIA - As per the CEMP
○ Foundations to be inspected by a suitably qualified geotechnical engineer to confirm they achieve bearing capacities prior to pouring

○ Where rock is encountered over part of the foundation only, or lies within 300mm below the underside of the mass concrete or selected fill, all material shall be removed to a depth of 300mm below the mass concrete or selected fill for the full width of the foundation over the length where the rock is encountered. This additional excavation shall be backfilled with ordinary backfill material.[C222.09]
○ Remove unsuitable material identified after superintendent inspection & instruction
○ Proof rolling to be carried out by water truck if directed by superintendent
CONFORMANCE CRITERIA - Survey pick up of foundation.
○ Survey pick up and confirmation of quantities and extent of any unsuitable materials removed.
CONFORMANCE CRITERIA - Field work complete subject to any outstanding test results being within allowed tolerance
CONFORMANCE CRITERIA - Lot conforms to specifications
○ Site specific Mix designs and or methodologies submitted to superintendent or their delegate for approval.
CONFORMANCE CRITERIA - JSEA prepared and signed off
CONFORMANCE CRITERIA - Detailed excavation completed to design tolerances
CONFORMANCE CRITERIA - Concrete vertical & horizontal dimensions set-out
CONFORMANCE CRITERIA - Suitable subgrade material and prepared to suitable surface for construction.

CONFORMANCE CRITERIA - Dimensions and positions of forms shall be carefully checked after the forms are erected. Forms shall be aligned accurately and the location of all fittings, hold formers etc. checked prior to placing of concrete.
○ Form oil applied to forms where required
○ Laps as per IFC drawings and Standards
○ Reinforcing steel located as per IFC drawings
○ Correct min 50mm cover maintained as per IFC drawings
CONFORMANCE CRITERIA - Test for slump as required
○ Take cylinders for strength testing as specified
○ Crack cylinders at specified times for conformance
FREQUENCY - Min 2 pairs of test specimens shall be moulded for each 15m3 of concrete, or part thereof.
CONFORMANCE CRITERIA - Concrete ordered correct strength and type
○ For RCBCs ensure approved mix is ordered
○ Avoid dropping from excessive height to avoid segregation
○ Finish type as specified by drawings or specifications
CONFORMANCE CRITERIA - As built survey complete and within tolerance
CONFORMANCE CRITERIA - Field work complete, subject to any outstanding test results being within allowed tolerance
CONFORMANCE CRITERIA - Lot conforms to specifications
CONFORMANCE CRITERIA - JSEA prepared and signed off
CONFORMANCE CRITERIA - Drains set out for excavation
○ Modify to match drainage structures where necessary
CONFORMANCE CRITERIA - Field work complete subject to any outstanding test results being within allowed tolerance
CONFORMANCE CRITERIA - Lot conforms to specifications
CONFORMANCE CRITERIA - JSEA prepared & signed off
CONFORMANCE CRITERIA - Survey set out as per drawings
○ Pipes supplied as per drawings layout plan & notes
○ Precast components are checked against the Acceptance Criteria provided in C222.19-2 (Refer table checklist attached)
CONFORMANCE CRITERIA - Excavation of trenches per specification
○ Laying and jointing as per specification
○ Layed to level and alignment as per specification
○ Grouted rock pitching at outlet as per plans
○ As per drawings layout plan and notes
CONFORMANCE CRITERIA - Field work complete, subject to any outstanding test results being within allowed tolerance
CONFORMANCE CRITERIA - Lot conforms to specifications
CONFORMANCE CRITERIA - JSEA prepared & signed off
CONFORMANCE CRITERIA - Survey set out as per drawings
○ Pipes supplied as per drawings layout plan & notes
○ RCBCs supplied are checked against the Acceptance Criteria provided in C222.19-2 (Refer table checklist attached)
○ No bedding material shall be placed until the foundations have been inspected and approved by the Certifying Engineer. [C222.10]

○ Mass concrete bedding for reinforced concrete bases shall not be placed on earth or rock foundations until the foundations have been inspected and approved by the Certifying Engineer. Following such approval, the surface of the foundation shall be dampened and a layer of concrete not less than 50mm thick shall be placed over the excavated surface and shall be finished to a smooth even surface.[C223.09]
○ Laying and jointing as per specification
○ Layed to level and alignment as per specification
○ Filling in between cells as per specification
○ As per drawings layout plan and notes
CONFORMANCE CRITERIA - Field work complete, subject to any outstanding test results being within allowed tolerance
CONFORMANCE CRITERIA - Lot conforms to specifications
CONFORMANCE CRITERIA - JSEA prepared and signed off
CONFORMANCE CRITERIA - Drains set out for excavation
○ Confirm extents and location of referred alluvial materials to be won
○ Quantify excavation amounts and used amounts
○ Test Samples: CBRs, plasticity and grading
○ Visual inspections of material to confirm suitability; testing required to generally comply with C213.36
○ Monitoring of processing materials to ensure consistency and usability
○ Hold Point when lay and compacting
REMARKS - Maximum lifts of 200mm of SMZ layers provided as relaxation.
○ Modify to match drainage structures where necessary
CONFORMANCE CRITERIA - Field work complete subject to any outstanding test results being within allowed tolerance
CONFORMANCE CRITERIA - Lot conforms to specifications
CONFORMANCE CRITERIA - JSEA prepared & signed off
○ Material delivered for testing for source approval
○ Visual deflection monitoring shall consist of proof rolling with truck dual wheels with a minimum axel weight of 9 tonnes which does not reveal any visible deflection
○ Blend into existing when no site won material is reused.
○ Ensure segregation of material does not occur
FREQUENCY - 1 per 500m2, With minimum 3 tests per lot.
CONFORMANCE CRITERIA - Field work complete subject to any outstanding test results being within allowed tolerance.
CONFORMANCE CRITERIA - Lot conforms to specifications
CONFORMANCE CRITERIA - JSEA prepared & signed off

○ Correct sized rock to be placed in completed drain profile and or revetment area to specification
○ Rock placement to conform to IFC drawings
○ Rock placed on geofabric where shown on drawings
CONFORMANCE CRITERIA - Rock placed to line and level as per IFC drawings

CONFORMANCE CRITERIA - Lot conforms to specifications
